title: 148863994.cryptocurrency And The Game Of Thrones
excerpt: Lots of friends have encouraged me to watch Game of Thrones , and my response is always the same.

children.text: Lots of friends have encouraged me to watch
, and my response is always the same.
I know it’s a glorious, fantastic, and amazing show. I’ve read the reviews.
It’s also 60 hours(!) long. And I can think of about a dozen other ways I’d rather spend the time.
Recently, I’ve been getting the same sort of ‘encouragement’ from friends who advocate learning about (and investing in) cryptocurrency.
It’s not that I don’t find it interesting, or potentially lucrative. But the opportunity cost of learning all the ins and outs of the trade, paired with reading about the
, and assessing—almost daily—what’s up and what’s down, is
large it doesn’t seem worth the trouble.
Sure. Someone is going to come out the other end a millionaire. But that doesn’t make it worth obsessing over, let alone spending any amount of your non-refundable time pursuing.
